page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: 4 1 Squares 1 & 2 contain Salford's overspill council estate built 3 2 after World War II to help solve a chronic housing shortage caused by slums, overcrowding and bomb damage. A new community has been created in what was a small rural mining village. Now there are schools, churches, half empty industrial estates, parks, cricket clubs, a golf course and thousands of residents. Square 3 contains part of Cutacre Clough, once Europe's largest coal slag heap, disused coal shafts, grazing and waste land. there are only a handful of residents. Square 4 is overshadowed by Cutacre Clough slag heap towering over the surrounding dairy farm land. There is a large chemical works and an open cast mine but few inhabitants.
